clinicalDescription: Overview: A potentially serious sleep disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts. Involuntary cessation of breathing that occurs while asleep. Presentation: snoring loudly and feeling tired even after a full night's sleep, dry mouth, insomnia, irritability. Assessment: sleep history, overnight monitoring at a sleep center (Nocturnal polysomnography)Plan: lifestyle changes, Continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP), oral appliances (keeping the throat open), surgery. Prognosis: Can be diagnosed and treated.
